place.name: BULCOTE
place.gazetteerText: BULCOTE, a chapelry in Burton-Joyce parish, Notts; on the river Trent and the Midland railway, 1 mile NE of Burton-Joyce r. station, and 4½ NW of Bingham. Post Town, Burton-Joyce, under Nottingham. Acres, 970. Real property, £1,139. Pop., 136. Houses, 24. The property is divided among a few. The living is a p. curacy, annexed to the vicarage of Burton-Joyce, in the diocese of Lincoln. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
